meanings.definition: A verbal error in which a speaker switches the initial sounds or letters of two or more words.
meanings.sent1: During the play, the actor accidentally made a spoonerism by saying 'tear tab' instead of 'tab tear'.
meanings.sent2: The teacher chuckled at the student's spoonerism when he said 'bunny rab' instead of 'runny bab'.
meanings.sent3: At the party, Sarah's spoonerism of 'cake make' instead of 'make cake' caused everyone to giggle.
meanings.sent4: His spoonerism of 'light bouse' instead of 'bright louse' shed a new perspective on the situation.
meanings.sent5: The spoonerism 'glue shoe' instead of 'shoe glue' stuck in everyone's memory.

meanings.definition: The act of making such an error in speech.
meanings.sent1: After the slip of the tongue, the comedian realized his spoonerism and laughed it off.
meanings.sent2: She apologized for the spoonerism in her presentation, where she said 'flipping lops' instead of 'slipping flops'.
meanings.sent3: The spoonerism 'butter fly' instead of 'flutter by' made the audience smile at the mix-up.
meanings.sent4: His spoonerism 'sunny day' instead of 'funny say' brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The spoonerism 'jelly bellow' instead of 'belly jello' echoed in everyone's ears.

meanings.definition: A humorous play on words resulting from such an error.
meanings.sent1: The comedian's spoonerism of 'silly billy' instead of 'billy silly' had the audience roaring with laughter.
meanings.sent2: The children enjoyed creating spoonerisms like 'mumble jumble' instead of 'jumble mumble' during the game.
meanings.sent3: His spoonerism 'pea cake' instead of 'key bake' made the conversation more entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The spoonerism 'butter nut' instead of 'nutter butt' added a fun twist to the story.
meanings.sent5: The spoonerism 'gummy bear' instead of 'bunny gear' became the talk of the town.
